title: Day 716
content:
# Day 716

Today, I will analyze the three primary shoes I use for running and walking.

Perks:

- Run a mile one minute faster than my average time.

- Super Bouncy.

- Look cool and feel fast.

Negatives:

- Ankles always hurt when I use them.

- Not helpful for improving the way I am naturally suppose to walk.

- Feels unnatural.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*ZQbksWD25HF617t7rjb7yQ.png)

Perks:

- Favorite style shoe ever designed.

- A happy medium between having some cushion but feeling natural.

- Least painful shoe to run in and baseline for average mile time of 9 minutes when I run in these.

Negatives:

- Not as fast as other shoes.

- Horrible for basketball (no ankle support).

- Takes a minute to break in so they feel just right and fit to your feet.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*UtHyPMa6NBFdFMEgQ8GdyA.png)

Perks:

- Most natural shoe that allows me to feel pain as my body intended.

- Corrects my walk so I walk as a human is supposed to walk.

- I like the color and fit.

Negatives:

- By far the most painful.

- Takes a minute off my average mile time.

- You feel rocks and the ground more which can be painful as you adjust to these shoes.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*3Kr4xr4uFL3MPlODikJmZg.jpeg)

3/7/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
